summary: The document is a DD Form 398, Statement of Personal History, for Edifanio Romero-Delgado, dated January 18, 1963. It details personal information including birth, family background, education, employment history, and questions regarding affiliations with certain organizations. Additionally, it covers foreign travel, military service, and includes a certification of the truthfulness of the provided information. The form is indicative of its use in a security or immigration context, specifically related to foreign personnel and organizations.
key_findings: Edifanio Romero-Delgado was born on January 21, 1936, in Candelario, Pinardel Rio, Cuba.
He entered the United States on September 21, 1962, through Texas and is not a U.S. citizen.
Romero-Delgado has a history of being detained for political reasons in Cuba in April 1961.
The document includes detailed personal and familial information, as well as inquiries about affiliations with communist or fascist organizations, to which Romero-Delgado answered negatively.
The form is part of a series related to foreign personnel and organizations, indicating its use in a security or immigration context.
